alert.note: Alert for Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Southern Inner Channels (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 3:54PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The following areas, Southern Inner Channels, Southeast Gulf Coast and Central Inner Channels. * WHEN...Until 115 AM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Possible isolated landslides in areas of steep terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 354 PM AKDT, satellite estimates and rain gauge data indicate heavy rain across the advisory area. Rapid river rises will cause minor flooding of small streams. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.25 inches are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ketchikan, Craig, Klawock, Thorne Bay, Hydaburg, Hollis, Metlakatla, Noyes Island, Mary Island, Tree Point, Saxman, Ward Cove, Bell Hot Springs, Port Alice, Duke Island, Kasaan, Meyers Chuck, Annette and Bobs Place.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.

area.areaDesc: Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Southern Inner Channels
